org.javasimon.jmx
Interface CounterMXBean

All Superinterfaces:
SimonSuperMXBean
All Known Implementing Classes:
CounterMXBeanImpl
public interface CounterMXBean
extends SimonSuperMXBean

Interface for MX Bean representing a particular Counter. It is not created by default when JMX is activated - it must be created explicitly. JmxRegisterCallback can be used to automate this.

Author:
Richard "Virgo" Richter

getIncrementSum

long getIncrementSum()
Returns the sum of all incremented values. If incremented value was negative, sum is lowered by this value.

Returns:
sum of all incremented values
Since:
3.3
See Also:

getDecrementSum

long getDecrementSum()
Returns the sum of all decremented values (as a positive number). If decremented value was negative, sum is lowered by this value.

Returns:
sum of all decremented values

3.3

sampleAndReset

@Deprecated
CounterSample sampleAndReset()
Deprecated. 

Description copied from interface: SimonSuperMXBean
Samples Simon values and returns them in a Java Bean derived from Sample interface and resets the Simon. Operation is synchronized to assure atomicity.

Specified by:
sampleAndReset in interface SimonSuperMXBean
Returns:
sample containing all Simon values

sampleIncrement

CounterSample sampleIncrement(String key)
Description copied from interface: SimonSuperMXBean
Samples increment in Simon values since the previous call of this method with the same key. When the method is called the first time for the key, current values are returned (same like from SimonSuperMXBean.sample(). Any subsequent calls with the key provide increments.

Clients should use a unique key (GUID, host name, etc.), to avoid interference with other clients.

Specified by:
sampleIncrement in interface SimonSuperMXBean
Parameters:
key - key used to access incremental sample
Returns:
Sample with value increments
